docs.lead_paragraph: A skittish species, related to the giraffe, is bred in captivity with a mix of patience, genetic know-how and romantic savoir-faire.

headline.seo: Birth of Bronx Zoo’s M’bura Overcomes Okapi Odds
headline.main: For a Baby Okapi, Don’t Push Too Hard
headline.print_headline: For a Baby Okapi, Don’t Push Too Hard

docs.abstract: Officials at Bronx Zoo celebrate unveiling of M'bura, healthy, 5-month-old okapi calf; okapis, relatives of giraffes, are notoriously skittish and difficult to breed in captivity.
docs.snippet: A skittish species, related to the giraffe, is bred in captivity with a mix of patience, genetic know-how and romantic savoir-faire.
